medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrence of flank pain and weakness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient last seen at a clinic, where an ERCP was performed and 2 stones were removed. Since that procedure, the patient has not felt back to baseline, experiencing right flank pain, poor appetite, poor ambulation, and low energy. The patient felt acutely weak again today with right flank pain, diaphoresis, lightheadedness, and nausea, but no vomiting. The flank pain is sharp and intermittent, worsened by deep inspiration and not specifically related to food intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), Idiopathic Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (IDT2DM), cholelithiasis, history of Polymyalgia rheumatica, anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with diabetes, died of CVA in late age. Father had a myocardial infarction at an unspecified age. Brother with unspecified condition.
